etymology.description: semantic: 氵(氵) (shuǐ, 'water') + phonetic: 良(良) (liáng, 'good') = water with a flowing nature -> wave
etymology.interpretation: The character combines the water radical 氵(氵) (shuǐ, 'water') with the phonetic component 良(良) (liáng, 'good'), suggesting the fluid and moving nature associated with waves.

examples.chinese: 海浪拍打着礁石(海浪拍打著礁石)。
examples.pinyin: Hǎi làng pāidǎ zhe jiāo shí.
examples.english: The sea waves are hitting the coral rocks.

examples.chinese: 他冲浪时(他衝浪時)，享受自由(享受自由)。
examples.english: When he surfs, he enjoys freedom.

examples.chinese: 浪花在风中飞舞(浪花在風中飛舞)。
examples.pinyin: Làng huā zài fēng zhōng fēiwǔ.
examples.english: The spray of the waves dances in the wind.
